page.title: 05HOUSING INTERVIEW
page.content:
An interview with Graham Allison, Head of Housing.
{Has residental housing suffered in {Salendine Nook through the economic {depression?}The majority of council housing in that area is post-war, centrally heated with all amenities, but some of the older houses could do with improvement. {Has the house building situation {improved during the last year?} Generally, new house building is decreasing year by year, although some schemes are now in the pipeline for elderly persons flats or bungalows. {What percentage of the population live {in council houses?}15.4% of residents in the Salendine Nook area live in council houses.This compares with 9.8% in the Lindley ward and 27.1% in the whole of Kirklees.
